title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 §§ 398-7.1 - Denial or discontinuance
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 §§ 398-7.1 - Denial or discontinuance

State Regulations
(a) An individual or couple who fails or
refuses to comply with a requirement of this Part without good cause shall not
be eligible to participate in the SSP or otherwise be eligible for SSPNA, and
an individual or couple otherwise eligible for SSP or SSPNA may be subject to
termination or denial of their SSP benefits or SSPNA. (b) The Office is responsible for determining
good cause pursuant to subdivision (a) of this section. In determining whether, or not good cause exists, the Office must consider the facts and circumstances, including information submitted by the recipient subject to the requirements of
this Part. (c) The recipient is
responsible for notifying the Office of the reasons for failing to comply with
a requirement of this Part and for furnishing evidence to support any claim of
good cause. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18
§§
398-7.1

Adopted by

New

York State Register September 24, 2014/Volume XXXVI, Issue 38, eff. 10/1/2014. Amended

New

York State Register January 13, 2021/Volume XLIII, Issue 02, eff. 1/13/2021

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
